metadata.title: CVE-2014-0144 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
QEMU before 2.0.0 block drivers for CLOOP, QCOW2 version 2 and variousother image formats are vulnerable to potential memory corruptions,integer/buffer overflows or crash caused by missing input validations whichcould allow a remote user to execute arbitrary code on the host with theprivileges of the QEMU process.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-0144` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

qemu - 2.0.0~rc1+dfsg-0ubuntu3
qemu-common - 2.0.0~rc1+dfsg-0ubuntu3
qemu-guest-agent - 2.0.0~rc1+dfsg-0ubuntu3
qemu-keymaps - 2.0.0~rc1+dfsg-0ubuntu3
qemu-kvm - 2.0.0~rc1+dfsg-0ubuntu3
qemu-system - 2.0.0~rc1+dfsg-0ubuntu3
qemu-system-aarch64 - 2.0.0~rc1+dfsg-0ubuntu3
qemu-system-arm - 2.0.0~rc1+dfsg-0ubuntu3
qemu-system-common - 2.0.0~rc1+dfsg-0ubuntu3
qemu-system-mips - 2.0.0~rc1+dfsg-0ubuntu3
qemu-system-misc - 2.0.0~rc1+dfsg-0ubuntu3
qemu-system-ppc - 2.0.0~rc1+dfsg-0ubuntu3
qemu-system-sparc - 2.0.0~rc1+dfsg-0ubuntu3
qemu-system-x86 - 2.0.0~rc1+dfsg-0ubuntu3
qemu-user - 2.0.0~rc1+dfsg-0ubuntu3
qemu-user-static - 2.0.0~rc1+dfsg-0ubuntu3
qemu-utils - 2.0.0~rc1+dfsg-0ubuntu3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: qemu package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.0.0~rc1+dfsg-0ubuntu3').
